I4xs2XgTYktEo7M65UBy4Q.text: ICCo is literally the cheapest and most delicious pizza you will find in london. End of story.

rJehBc9VbllP7dTAy0Ob1Q.text: Excellent quick pizza, clearly a hit with the locals as they are very busy. Sit down in a clean, pleasant cafe environment or takeaway.Its also a cafe so the coffee is great too.

aDfXOZ6m6E6d1BzxU_Q1qQ.text: Dear Gods of Pizza,how cruel thou are. When I wished to spread the gospel of freshly-made pizza, I found Icco had revealed it already.When I begged for pizza pretention to end and pizza common sense to triumph in menus, thou had bestowed such grace on Icco before me.Thou vanquished by the power of Icco my political movement for an end to posh sit-downs in favour of no-nonsense high tables and stools before I could make a difference.Thou also disproveth through thy prophet Icco the myth of the expensive London, depriving so many expense account beneficiaries of excuses to max out corporate credit cards.Having fed my Italian pride, wounded by years of witnessing pizza abuse, on the healing shores of Icco I endeavor to spread the Gospel of Pizza.If you can't go to Naples, go to Icco. Yum!

nUZUBw5YTJdgQKPrv13_Ug.text: If you want decent pizza you've got to check this place out. They cook fresh pizzas with whatever toppings you like in about 5-10minutes. They're tasty and authentically Italian with good quality coffees available too. Not only is the quality great but the price is very low too!I wouldn't go here for dinner, unless I was on the go, because it's cold and uncomfortable. However, it's great for lunch. It's effectively just a great quality fast food joint serving excellent pizza for next to nothing.Pro's: Quality pizza, quality coffee, friendly service, quick service, very cheap.Con's: Not good for a sit down dinner.

Al6DJq7EDZQ_iZzD4i5CAQ.text: Fantastic cheap pizza which tastes great at any hour. It's not the best pizza you'll ever eat but it's certainly not the worst. Icco is always bustling with diners of all ages, but with University College nearby, a lot of the time it's students, and who can blame them/us!? Great food, great environment and really fun to go with a group of friends. And there's plenty of bars nearby for afters...!

xojZX4UwLQKW9f-1Kindqw.text: A nice set up where you order your pizza at the counter and given a buzzer and once the pizza is done you go and collect it.I'm sure you won't get a better price in this area (all around £6) but the pizzas are definitely lacking in taste a bit. I found the bases completely bland and was pretty disappointed with the stingey amount of toppings! I ordered a pizza with olives and artichokes and only got about 3 of each of them!I recommend you grab one of the oils to add to your pizza to give some more taste! The garlic one was delicious.I would probably come back here purely for the price, but not somewhere I was crazy about!

lpuw_j2snA0KrsybO0sXRA.text: If you're looking for a delicious cheap Italian eat, look no further than the Italiano Coffee Co! With an 11inch pizza starting at £3.50 and the highest pizza on the menu just £5.90, it's possible to have a complete meal for under 5pounds in Central London! When I went to the Italiano Coffee Co, my friend who's a vegetarian didn't feel left out, because there's a vegetarian pizza complete with fresh shallots, sweetcorn and peppers for just £4.50. There are also cakes, coffee, smoothies, etc if you don't want to eat pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom. Italiano Coffee Co.

Ul4IRE57YJqWmBvDUXySdg.text: A big one for UCL students. 5£ pound delicious pizza.

sPIOVImIKajGwPpxKOvswg.text: Yesterday I had breakfast here  it was lovely and the my friend and I had a couple of lovely cappuccinos. I liked their way of greeting people.

fA1gUOLJ5Y6S6BiaxtGOXQ.text: There is nothing that could go wrong with this place if you want a good cheap pizza!We've been living round the area for the last 2 1/2 years, we've been recommended to try out this place. It smelt excellent every time we go past it and makes me more intrigue!Reluctant to be disappointed by another piece of pizza (as I was never a fan of it - yes I am weird), I decided to give it a go with my bf at the weekend and I never looked back.I had the special and absolutely enjoyed it. Mozzarella cheese, tomato, olives, anchovies and a fried egg. DELICIOUS! It was £4.50 or was it £5.00. My boyfriend had the Hawaiian. He loved it too!The atmosphere is brilliant. It's busy, but not over crowded, and feel at ease to eat in there. Pizza is made fresh and when it's ready, you'll get buzzed to pick it up! One piece of advice, mind the hot plate when you pick it up!

ffCiyVeQE3xHF87PztSy3g.text: Lord have mercy, can't the Italians do better than this?  You get what you pay for.  By the time I ate my pizza funghi (which was practically a margherita due to the lack of toppings), it was cold.  Bland too. Only thing going for Icco is the price.  Definitely not the service-I have yet to have a pleasant exchange. Highly overrated. Point: Even if you're drunk and/or starving, think twice.  If mediocre food and service with a 'tude bother you, think thrice .

yb3iveKtp1ZcSx-apOYrMw.text: A fiver for a pizza?! Heck YES! It oddly enough reminded me of Sbarro's (from the States), and I could easily eat a whole pizza from there (don't judge). Don't come expecting a seat at lunchtime, seriously, this place is TEAMING! Chocked full to the rafters! I've only ever been successful once at getting a seat.

yZewNiqagrPB9Mc03yvpng.text: Cheap. Seriously Seriously cheap. £3.50 for an 11" pizza. And it tastes good, food appears fast, it's open all hours, atmosphere buzzes... what more do you want?Go there!

A1N4maP_h0GIgD-QDfIMWA.text: This a brilliant Pizzeria Iccos make delicious Pizzas that are amazing value, a margarita costs £3, if you add more toppings you pay extra but you never pay more than £4. I love going here with my friends as it's a great place to come and get some quality cheap pizza. The stainless steel interior reminds me of the New York Pizzerias!The only downside is it's always busy and it can be hard to get a table sometimes but they allso do takeaway! and you can sit outside in the summer!

photos.caption: Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom

3yUESULxMODhiX0fVYIVAw.text: Absolutely love this place. First the pizzas are very tasty in fact the best I have ever eaten in town yet! Then I really like the italo-american cantina atmosphere as well as the tables outside by the road. And last but not least the price ! £5 for a pizza, a total bargain for the quality of the food they serve. Highly recommended with friends before a night out.

qpbnLbqpQhFbN4TfgOS3dg.text: I was feeling in a healthy mood when I came here yesterday and went for The Greek Salad and the Detox Smoothie (strawberry, apple and pineapple...yummmmy!) The greek salad was only 2.50 and very tasty! Next time I'll get one of the massive Pizzas!!

kiF4ForRbWv46FT98HeHPg.text: For a fiver you could get yet another fancy sandwich from from somewhere down the street, or how about doing exactly what you did yesterday and just getting another 'Meal Deal' from Boots, M&S or Tescos then sitting unfulfilled, looking at the packaging waste you just created?OR...You could sit with a real plate, real cutlery, a selection of oils and herbs and have a whole thin-crust Italian pizza to yourself and get a Snapple with it. Fuck it, you can even read the papers for free and watch the TV if there is some big sporting event on.ICCO is quite possibly the best way you can spend a Fiver in London and get full on a real decent pizza. It's cheaper than buying a frozen one from Sainsbury's and then using up gas and dishes to cook it. The only problem is knowing when to stop treating ICCO as your kitchen, lounge and mum all rolled into one!Good for morning coffee by the street, great for lunch before it gets too busy, and wonderful for take-out dinner when you're drinking at a pub nearby and need pizza with your patio/pavement beers. Trust me. I once ate a day's all three meals here.

16oIjImiXmSl4GHLKXB-cQ.text: I never really understood why a pizza place was called the Italiano Coffee Company - beyond that, ICCO was so inexpensive, and the pizzas were SUPER good - we ordered a simple pepperoni pizza and cappricioso pizza and the crust was razor thin and crispy, toppings were perfectly up to snuff, and they were served very quickly.  Not difficult to find a seat either, and there was very quick turnover here as well.  I shall return.

OsV7niO_hwm4iv_rGoO8TQ.text: Hard to beat: excellent thin crust pizza eat-in or take away for less than a fiver, that's a sure winner!

photos.caption: Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom

21wMA2TyBIE_XCtpkejUzA.text: I was wondering if value for money still existed, but this busy all day - all evening joint still has it. Popular with students and local office workers you can order a pizza made fresh and the pager they give you will buzz. You collect and eat. Simple as, if you want to do sandwiches they are half price after 4pm and if you want a hot drink before noon, you get a free croissant. I haven't done either of those things because when I come here, it is for pizza that is £5 or less.

NaWJnzsjvHp9B9hKmKB-Bg.text: Busy as hell!! Get there early if you want to leave in reasonable time on a working day for lunch.The pizza is abso-lutely amazing. Great value for money. I like their token system - which is widely used in India in the huge malls.All in all lovely. The waiting is a headache though - so I dock 1 star for that.

J9I1xzXu1b0pMuXPRXlruA.text: Ah, faithful Icco.You were always there when I needed you.You kept me alive when I couldn't be bothered to cook.You kept me out of debt because your prices are exceptionally reasonable.That said,  you're more than likely a contributing factor to my having put on so much weight in my last year at uni.Amazing pizza, pretty fast service. Gets unbelievably busy around lunch/dinner time owing to good prices, and NUMEROUS student halls within 3 mins walking distance.The only real fault I can find is that they could never get my name right.

koTqMEDRD3ItHGxtvVjuzQ.text: Cheeeeeeeap pizza did I say cheap?Ok I know you Fitzrovia veterans out there will tell me it used to cost just £3 for a pizza and coffee back-in-the-day, but forward to the present, consider inflation, the Goodge street location and speed of service... and I think paying just £4 for a freshly made WHOLE pizza, is quite the bargain (even less if you're a 'margarita' type).The pizzas are very decent indeed, thin crust Italian style without too much cheese, nor too wet from tomato paste overdose. ICCO certainly know what they're doing!

jKBE73fYxYfMyRduHcfBFg.text: I've been here twice and really like the pizzas, very tasty and the most important: cheap! and the service is really fast! if you don't find any place open late this is your place :) they also have take away

yX0ihmJlDLPvXEDnYV1vNg.text: Good value (great cheap pizzas) quick & easy food & drink but the staff! well. how much time have you got?Just the nicest anywhere in London for Fast Food :Loyal, caring & fun : I love this place!All business managers take note of this eaterie : staff are your most importantasset : treat them well & they will loyally remain.De bonne valeur (les pizzas sont delicieux et moins cher ) vitesse,facile a manger mais les personnel! alors . vous avez l'heure? Ils sont simplementle meilleur a Londres pour le Fast Food : fideles, aux bons soins et de bonheur  J'adore cet endroit!Alors, faites attention! vos personnel sont l'avantage le plus importantes : soyez gentile et puis ils restent la

photos.caption: Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom. Afrin,Joanna,Arben & Baibar : so nice!
Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom. Erica & Anna, two of the lovely staff
Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom. Lucacz & the manager Azzem

AZLZxpKBS3_iSkNhUVN3OQ.text: Good value pizza in a cafeteria style atmosphere. The pizzas here are cheap and tasty, they are even cheaper if you decide to take them away. They have a large range of pizzas which are about 10", you can also modify your pizza by adding extra toppings. Great place to go if you looking for somewhere cheap for a bite to eat in central London, not far from Oxford St.

5p3X6ZvvEMVAQW_dmzZuQw.text: Been eating here since Uni days when it first opened back in 1999. Still a firm favourite, especially before/after watching a match down the road at Italia Uno. Can't be beaten in terms of value for money - good pizza, great price.

-OPdONKZRhVzkmdO4Rsxlw.text: This is literally my all time favourite pizza place - and I eat a lot of it. Great price and atmosphere too!

gLLKjDRQbdO5BZI2WKPSfw.text: Stopped into Icco for lunch with a couple of colleagues one chilly January day. pizzas are made right in front of you and dramatically manoeuvred out of the oven for an impressive rapid scoring before being served. They have that funny system where they give you an electronic beacon which buzzes when the pizza is ready. Works well enough, and is a nice counterpoint to the Italian authenticity of the place. My artichoke pizza was indeed delicious throughout the afternoon.

0lkIyqDn_5gdKdqiZojBsw.text: As you walk past the smell is amazing and makes you want a pizza. Unfortunately tastes nothing like the smell. Very boring and bland pizzas with no seasoning. Cheap pizza though so I guess you get what you pay for!

OlyRVuBi0JLdZE4HGMzAiQ.text: Pizza here ia A-OK... Nothing amazing but the price. Reasonable prices for the amount of food for a college area.

LqB1l7Q0pKMR4mmA2mU0PA.text: I had been to this restaurant today on recommendation by a friend, the restaurant is good, but what disappointed me was i was waiting for my pizza for more than 20 min. At Last i went to counter to check my order when i found that my pizza was given to someone else. You have a very high tech system in place for your orders despite that how can one do this ? And even no apologies, was not a good experience

jOCMI9cS78StB0sUDG2Mxg.text: I wish this place didn't have an average of four stars, because I regret coming here on my last day in London. The pizza was flabby and there was nothing special about it except the price.

tTap2Lovgb0Alrg_sD2kuA.text: Not a fan. No personal sizes for either pizza or salad. Counter scene was confusing (to me). I ordered a margarita pizza and got a gloppy, flavorless cheese pizza instead. They don't have a wine license. I think it's better for locals and people on a budget. Wasn't to my taste and I went over to Spaghetti House where I had a real meal. Value is more than 3£ -- sometimes price isn't the only thing. I can see how it would have tremendous appeal for some but when your order gets messed up because the counter staff and you can't communicate over the loud music, well . . .

_YDL4MQS8nrebFFgrj9Epw.text: Is it wrong that one of the cheapest pizzas in London is also my favourite?  I ate at this place the very first time I was in London (backpacking around Europe), as it was listed in my travel guide, and even though one of the busboys there asked me out on a date with I accidentally agreed to (I couldn't understand him very well) and I ultimately stood him up (sorry! You seemed nice but I had a boyfriend!), I pushed past the awkwardness and continued eating there every Friday when I moved to London as a student.I'm no longer a student, but I still eat there whenever I'm in the area.  The pizzas are cheap (though not as cheap as they used to be), but they're amazing!  I'm really picky about pizza, in that I will only eat thin crust pizza with a non-chunky, non-overwhelming sauce, and lots of delicious cheese, and this fits the bill perfectly.  It is deliciously greasy and floppy, and usually ready within 10 minutes, even if it's really busy, so there's not much waiting around before you can shovel it into your face.  I adore it, and I hope they don't change a thing. Well, if they had to change something, I'd love to see some shakers of parmesan and garlic salt, a la New York style pizza, but I can live without it.  Just keep the pizzas coming!

osUqNojiR1ITrZA9i9ofuw.text: Despite the name, who really cares about the coffee served here? Okay, a few, but with Starbucks etc strewn around the area, the real reason anyone comes here is for the cheap but delicious pizza's. Starting at around Â£3.50, you just give your order and wait amongst other spendthrifts and students and wait for you ticket to be called out. It's like a pizza lottery as you can never really hear what or who they're calling and so you may shuffle up to the counter more than once until it is actually yours. The pizza's are thin-based, have good amount of toppings and are quite large, certainly filling. And for the cheap cost it certainly better than most fast food.

photos.caption: Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom. Icco

LiFzaw3p1Zd_qhiDYLrmOw.text: To many Icco is a well-kept secret.  This may not be the impression you get when you first visit due to its loyal customer base, but this establishment is pretty unique in London.  It manages to cross the divide between a restaurant and café hangout, with its low prices and continental atmosphere, yet superior pizzas.  During the day its emphasis is on relaxed coffee and quick lunches for the local workforce, but in the evenings and weekends it takes on a somewhat different air as a lively pizza diner.  With its easy, quick, and often entertaining system (prepare to have you name hollered out across the restaurant when your order is ready), as well as its central location it is the ideal stop-off before a night out or for a late-night takeaway pizza.  The concise choice of pizzas available at Icco provides all the classics plus a few more.  The pizzas are of the authentic Italian style, hand rolled with thin crispy bases, as to be expected of an authentic Italian establishment. The four cheeses and special pizzas are particularly worth a mention for their use of fresh, tasty ingredients that may make you think twice about paying twice the amount elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom
Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom

2ROZX4fEz3H2iZ6OtxtBiA.text: The pizzas here are very tasty, having in mind their cost. That is what pleasantly surprised me. Good job.

20O5kxzUE7bO9mttRf0cog.text: Having seen it absolutely full the other day, I decided try if apart from cheap, their pizza is also good as iit attracts so many pizza lovers. The place looks a bit a crude and in a way gives you New York-ish feeling. It's self serviced. You order and pay at the counter, but instead of getting usual plastic number, you receive a strange device that starts to vibrate when your food is ready. Pretty high tech for such a low key place:) The pizza is OK, value for money I'd say (though the fresh basil on mine and the basil sauce on my boyfriend's were missing). Apart from pizza they have cheap salads, muffins and drinks. The toilet was the funny bit. You have to walk throughout their kitchen to get there, which can be nice as you can see the chefs at work, but when you realize they prepare your food next to the open toilets, it's less appealing.

uSaZSYMG8-jwcOUkpOeyig.text: Ecco Pizza is great!! Their lunchtime special is £3.50 for an 11' pizza and it's really fresh and tasty!!! I can't recommend this place enough - it's a little gem in the city!!

BjVRw5qeEvDWhCPFEKBNCw.text: You can't beat this place for location and price!I walked and and after seeing the prices on the board, part of me kept thinking, is that price for a slice or a whole pizza?!?!? Prices start at £3.95 for a margherita and our delicious 4 cheese pizza was £5. If you're hungry, you'd probably want your own but for a late night snack, a pizza between the two of us did the trick. On the side, you can help yourself to garlic oil, chilli oil, oregano and chilli flakes. You order at the counter and after paying, you are given a little vibrating coaster. The order didn't take long at all, maybe 5 minutes? We picked up our pizza, decorated it with the extras and tucked in. We also saw loads of people getting pizzas for takeaway.  A testament to its popularity in the area! ICCo has been here for as long as I can remember and to see a restaurant like this survive in the presence of some bigger restaurants in Fitzrovia is good to see.A must if you're in the area and up for a quick, wallet-friendly bite to eat!

mQKP1XtLZNZZ30BLkaZCdA.text: Solid pizza at a great price! Quick and fresh, great crust, made to order. Only downside is that the meat toppings are a bit lower-quality, so I stick to the basics: cheese, veggies, or occasionally the pepperoni. Also, I love the garlic and chili oil they have among the condiments!

D1pXWTvDUm6WUCjnoznFZg.text: ICCo is delicious and cheap!! We go here often, because for 6£ you can get a whole pizza that you have to strain to eat - but you definitely do. It is big and the wait for your pizza is usually 5-10 minutes. There are about 15 options - all seem to use pretty fresh ingredients. I love the one with a fried egg on top. Tip - definitely pour the garlic olive oil all over your pizza. It only makes it even more delicious.

DINF7NutFHOqq-s_PDdznw.text: Icco had great prices for central london. I felt my pepperoni and mushroom pizza lacked flavor. Maybe it was the pizza sauce, the cheese... I can't put a finger on it. It was not the best pizza I have ever had and I left feeling greasy. The chili sauce and chili flakes where a fight to get a hold of as there was only one bottle for the whole place. They had no Tabasco which I am pretty sure is a MUST for a pizza place! The chili oil was questionable if it was even chili oil as it just seemed like orange oil, which had no flavor. This would not be my first stop if I was hungry in the area but I may give this place one more go to redeem itself. If you just want something quick & cheap, go there but don't expect the best pizza in the world, but its not the worst either!

sOKUqT3NDPLyhIcUYoN9gQ.text: Huge italian style pizza which tastes good and really hits the spot... Service is quick and friendly but finding a free table can be difficult as it gets very busy with students... All in all good value cheap eats

photos.caption: Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom. Icco margherita

MpdgGeyWcZMHOtLVcM6Ctw.text: Our pizza place of choice for a quick eat around central London. Freshly cooked, cheap, good menu selection, quick and fun atmosphere with locals. I love the thin and crusty thickness of it and the size that is perfect for one person. The toppings looked sparse at firs, especially looking at it from an American stomach/eye but not so noticeable when your enjoying it. Fancy a pizza with egg? Checkout the special. According to my curious hubby, it was not too bad.

N_PPB9oVPhx0aWyDWah0BQ.text: This place is so cheap (about £5 for a whole pizza!) and really close to Bloomsbury campuses. I now come here all the time with my boyfriend when we need a snack break from studying because the pizzas are delicious and filling. We usually have to split the pizza because it's so large.I've been here several times now and each time the pizza is always amazing. I 100% recommend this place especially for students looking for a good cheap place to eat.

4cBPk1ha_z3HS4DxI-WMcw.text: The trick is to order the right type of pizza here. I've tasted various pizza types, such as vegeterian, anchovy, pepperioni etc. All have been only substantial. I only order one type and its Cappricioso pizza with jalapeno peppers for years. Its the best pizza I've taste in London, there is something special about ham, olives, mushrooms and jalapenos which makes the cheap pizza some what special!

cKyjeEV1oe_W17YjMBk6fQ.text: This place is a goldmine - especially for broke college students. The pizza is cheap (margarita pie is 3.95 pounds) and not pretentious in the least. It has comfortable seats, thin crust pizza and won't make you feel as though you just emptied your wallet.

MsYhPoFwrN4O8Ni85TnTuQ.text: A workmate kept telling me how he and his friends would always cycle here after an eventful day around town, so one day I decided to try it out. A few of us had previously been in the bar for a few drinks after work, and instead of heading down Chinatown like we do most weeks, I suggested we go check out this Icco's pizza place.When we arrived, I must admit I had a bit of trouble deciding what to get, remembering what pizza another friend had told me about, I went along with the 'Brunch' pizza. This consisted of Sausage Meat, a Fried Egg, Tomato sauce but minus the cheese. As it was a pizza I was looking for, it was an easy choice for me to choose cheese as an extra.What a bloody pizza!I can't believe you get a whole pizza! I think it's something like a 11inch or 12inch pizza too! I didn't expect my little body to cram it all in but I did! None of that topping sliding off the base action here, just pure stringy cheese, and toppings galore! I'd never had an egg on my pizza prior to this, but I think it may just be a keeper! Sprinkle a few chilli flakes over the pizza for some added heat to that pizza, it's the bees knees, trust me!I will most definitely be back here, heck, I can see myself becoming a regular!

photos.caption: Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom. Brunch Pizza with Cheese.

WtfO-32wyvPw2Mei9fyvUg.text: Not my thing. Crust was good, but the toppings, namely the chicken and bacon, weren't very tasty at all. Almost no sauce on the pie at all. Quite bland. Service was outstanding though.

YgOscrXR8iKRmxPDiwRFCg.text: As it has been said before for the price and location alone this is a great place. The pizza is good, I wouldn't say the best ever but I also wouldn't expect the best ever for prices from £3.95 and in my view this is a pretty good pizza and much better than I would expect for the price. There is also a great drink selection including freshly squeezed juices which are also very reasonably priced for the area. It is wise to pick the time that you go carefully as it is so speedy when quiet but can get very busy. ICCo for me is the perfect place for when you have out of towners visiting and you (and your wallet) are exhausted after a a day of sight seeing or shopping or both and need a refuel/pit stop. This is a very specific need I know but one which for me often arises, and the many people who eat there attest to how great it is for more general eating needs!

zlryQbjF3zqKNbs6RHaSCQ.text: I work a lot in Soho and if there is one cheap place to go to for lunch it's Icco. You can get a whole pizza to yourself for around £5. This Italian place has been around for a while and I love the funghi (mushroom) pizza. I also get Snapple (who else sells this drink?!) sit down next to window and watch the world go by as I wait for my buzzer that they give lights up to let you know when the order is ready to collect from the front.

u377DzZlPmnCrROHZ_kwdQ.text: Went for a cheap late night meal and icco pizza hit the spot! I highly recommend the brunch pizza- who knew egg on pizza tasted so good!It's definitely best enjoyed warm so if you are getting take out, definitely try and eat it within the hour. Even cold, I thought it was sill pretty good. Thin crust and not too greasy

TSRVq_65L_PO0X4aM4Gdxw.text: On our never-ending quest to try cheap lunch places around work, we decided to give pizzas a try. First off the pizzas are CHEAP. It's kind of shocking to see the prices. I can see why it would do well so close to UCL as the students probably love it. Second, the pizzas are HUGE. I was shocked to see how big they were considering the price.I blasphemed and ordered the Hawaiian pizza. It was one of the more expensive pizzas they have (coming in at a whole £6 for dining in), and it was quite reminiscent of home. While many people don't like fruit on pizzas, I'm a fan. The pizza wasn't super decked out with toppings, but given the crust is quite thin, I think there's a good proportion of toppings to crust ratio (which you always want) and there wasn't too much cheese to drop off the crust.It wasn't the best pizza I've ever eaten, but it's definitely better than some of the imported American chains (I'm talking about you Pizza Hut, Domino's and Papa John's). If I'm feeling particularly hungry, I'll be back, or maybe next time I should just be good and order a salad.

J4cmz7dBAbfpXHn7GCXNzg.text: Quick Delicious Pizza for £5 with seating area, knives, forks and with organised collection! You cant grumble at that! Was really impressed with how good it tastes too. Will definitely be back.

AK_Aytnve6nw-Is6rKpAWw.text: This is so reminiscent of the motherland (NY/NJ), it's insane. Very good value pizza, starting from £3.50 and super quick. The pizza is cooked fresh though and comes out steaming hot and greasy. The place itself is quite basic, reminds me of the pizzerias back home but with more seating (and definitely busier!). You order up front and they give you a plastic gadget that buzzes when your food is ready to collect. Very similar to restaurants in America where they give those to you when your table is ready to be seated.I've been here at least a few times since I discovered it, and with lots of different toppings. It's not the best pizza I've ever had, but one of the best in London for the price and closeness to my uni. It probably could be a little less greasy with crispier crust (they tend to be a bit floppy!), but for the price I love it. Very similar quality to Pizza Express without the ridiculous price tag. My friend and I have definitely been the envy of our office though the few times we've cheekily nipped here for lunch :)

XHT8pkWyxAfeOaHAgQDmGA.text: First and foremost - really good pizza. One size pizza but it's average to large size. Wide choice of toppings with the traditional dishes - Hawaiian, four cheeses, pepperoni - as well as more elaborate concoctions. Extra toppings aren't too expensive. Wide choice of condiments: garlic and chilli oil, chilli flakes, oregano. Secondly - incredibly cheap. Pizzas starts from £3 and rarely go above £6. Sauces - garlic and herb, BBQ - cost about 50p. Condiments are free. Thirdly - great atmosphere. Popular with students but not in a bad way. The place is usually busy but it keeps the atmosphere alive and fresh. Even better when an Italian football game is on Loyalty cards are also available: half price pizza at 5 stamps, free pizza at 10 stamps. Watch out for expiration dates though. Star knocked off due to pizza being a bit greasy. But most people wouldn't care.

FV7z-jKKq9bpuLyUYxfoYg.text: A whole, thin crust, crispy, cooked-to-order pizza for under a fiver?!What's more, they're open late and the quality's quite decent given the price point.

XRAb9_lcIcFDPx5pe-KrsQ.text: Food in London is known for being tasteless and boring, but not at ICCo! I was referred to it by a local and I love it. I went on a rainy day and it was packed with locals just stopping by for a quick bite. I had a pepperoni pizza which was 4.50 pounds, and thats a great deal considering a lot of other dining options are far pricier. The pizza is relatively quick and I like that they hand make it on the spot so you know its fresh. The pizza is thin, the crust is perfect, and they stick to the basics. Thumbs up!If you want to see my pizza, you can catch my video blog about it here:youtu.be/N-6lyyYB0Pg

aYKW-EWQ4-pKKEeaMni0HQ.text: For cheap pizza and a game called find the chilli flakes, this place is hard to top, particularly based on the area.When you arrive you feel transported back 2 decades or more. It's a diner, but not deliberately made to look all hipster dated or chic. It just is. The place is generally clean, and there are plenty of tables to grab. Everything here is first come first served, so if you want that table, take it. Need some chilli sauce and there's none left at the cutlery area? Take it (after asking nicely of course) from somebody else's table. I have a feeling people resort to hiding it as to not lose what is like the ring from LOTR. Thus the game of find the chilli flakes/oil that people refer to.You order at the food area, and they even do just straight up milk, which surprised me, but as I know, milk tastes best with pizza, so I ordered that with my ham and olives.You get given a buzzer which goes off within 5 minutes or so, and you're eating. The pizza wasn't the best I've had, but it was big and the chilli flakes were a great addition. The problem is with pizza this cheap, they're going to skimp a little on the ingredients which was evident from the 6 olives on the pizza with none in the middle zone. Even cutting them in half and spreading around a bit would have been nicer personally. But I'm complaining about a pizza that cost £6.50. It's indecent but I just thought I should mention it.Some of the meat is halal certified too, so double check if this is a requirement for you.

photos.caption: Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom. Ham and Olive Pizza. A second later the chilli flakes were gone

lV3_PuJl25nGIgfm_XsNIg.text: I was super thrilled to check this place out because it has a vegan pizza option. The pizzas are pretty cheap for London standards, but are about the quality of NYC dollar pizza. The vegan pizza had very few toppings, and the vegan cheese was only present in about four small clumps. They are large pizzas, which is a plus, and I guess one must appreciate the fact that they at least tried to do a vegan option. The other pizzas looked much better so don't judge it just on this review, unless you're a fellow vegan.

photos.caption: Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom
Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom

E2h1v1FjDKACyXrRWim5og.text: ICCo has long been a haunt of me and my friends following a wander around the Fitzrovia Lates Art Gallery Openings, although they've long grown to hate us for eating our 'take-away' Pizzas at the tables outside (which're otherwise going to waste of a Thursday evening) and for bringing along a few cans of Beer, although the can't sell alcohol themselves.But despite what the staff think of us, I do get a bit nostalgic for this place when away from it. For where it's situated in Fitzrovia, the price of these Pizzas (£6.70 gets my girlfriend and I a Pizza large enough to share) and the taste more than makes up for the dirty looks we get, despite the scant meat toppings we receive every time.

photos.caption: Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom

3itXV2ZBTnPmXupBuS4mWQ.text: Great little place for a quick and fast cheap eat.They serve authentically Italian (or what I'd imagine to be authentic) thin crust pizzas that are freshly made to order. You can easily have a drink and a pizza for £10 with change to spare. Definitely a good place to go if you want good food quick.

3b5zMo3zjV4HqNGEtiLrCg.text: I think this is my favourite pizza place in London. 1. It's cheap. Not insultingly "is this real cheese" cheap, just cheap enough that I was happy coming here several times a week for lunch (£5-10 a pizza). I put a lot of weight on. 2. They make it fresh which is nice, takes about 10 minutes, maybe 15-20 if they're super busy (which isn't that unusual) but you can call it in if you're time poor. 3. It's REALLY GOOD. I can't stress this enough. It's really really good. Admittedly I had the same pizza pretty much every time (past tense as it's no longer geographically feasible to get there in a lunch break, otherwise it would be present tense, damn laws of physics...)4. It's ridiculously chill. In a manic way. Big metal tables with metal stools. Little metal tables with metal chairs if you want... Romance? The toilet is downstairs and through a weird purgatory style store room. This is somewhere you come to eat good pizza and hang out. It's not the latest and greatest. It's a golden oldie. Here there be no hipsters. So go here. I would say it's worth the 15 minute walk from Oxford street. You could get a frozen yogurt after from over the road. That's always a treat. Did I mention I put on weight?

jsR86LIqYG6ViFK2Fzq1hw.text: Yelp said is open on saturday untill midnight! But I ve been here at 2325 and no pizza!!!!!:(

QoGyBn6YDQCTjQppJzSJAw.text: You get what you pay for.Under 6 pounds for a whole pizza is amazing. That being said, the pizza is nothing special. It was dry and the bland and really nothing that excited my foody desires. "Freshly squeezed orange juice" was extremely warm, although I'm not sure they can do much about that.Most of all the service was quite meh. They do their job but no smiles not happiness no nothing. Definitely won't come back. But if you're in the mood for food to fill up your stomach for not a lot of money, this is the place for you.

YUsQhBFLybI4sGcnrpKBcg.text: Always a bit of a puzzle for me. I know that objectively ICCos isn't the best pizza around but it's always immensely satisfying, and the sort of place I find myself craving, even if I'm not quite sure why.Ambiance:There's something incredibly inviting about it. Interior is pretty bare. Some low (normal height) tables around the edges, while the middle is dominated by long counters with stools. Doesn't sound special and it's not but there's always a good level of crowd. Even if it's packed, you can usually find a seat, and it just feels warm and cozy.Prices:Since I started going in 09, there was one generic price increase, and one further change where they started charging 50p to eat in. That being said, it's still fairly cheap pizza. I think it's 4.50 for a margerita, and 6.30 for a capriciosa. I could also be completely off with these figures but I think that's about right.Pizza:Nice slightly chewy dough. They tend to scrimp a bit on toppings but still awesome. I tend to add either garlic/chilli oil depending on my mood.Others:Idk why but I always get a snapple when I'm here. It just fits. They now also sell dipping sauces (probably around 2 years ago but it still feels recent somehow), so I tend to get a garlic and herb sauce for the crust.Bottom line:Not sure I'd trek to check it out, but if you're in the area, I don't think you can find a more satisfying pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom. ICCos - not the best pizza in the world and yet, always immensely satisfying. Something you find yourself craving regardless.

Y2V7moBwqaB05gVz1v1Njw.text: I chose to eat here specifically because they offer vegan options. I got the vegan cheese pizza and at first I thought they had accidentally given me dairy cheese because usually you can tell the difference between the two just by looking and my pizza looked and tasted exactly like it had dairy cheese (although it for sure was vegan).We have a different brand of vegan cheese that is popular here in North America, and don't get me wrong, it's still delicious and I get pizzas with it all the time, but it almost tastes like a hybrid between mozzarella cheese and alfredo sauce, whereas the kind they use in London tasted exactly like a blend of mozzarella and cheddar. SO GOOD. After tasting one bite of that vegan cheese pizza I devoured the whole thing to myself and I'm not sure why everyone doesn't order the dairy free cheese when they go there - same taste but absolutely no bloating haha! 10/10!

2LpzkWrn5QFu4BndLA0NuA.text: Awesome pizza for a cheap buck. Absolutely delicious, quick, and perfect cheese to tomato sauce ratio. Only bad thing is that dining in is more expensive. But still probably the best affordable pizza around.

FdF-xAZim6QeH0YemVl9dQ.text: Fairly good pizza selection especially for the price. Gets a little busy during the evenings / weekends (especially after drinking at the local pub) but a great place to grab something quick before heading home.

photos.caption: Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom. Margarita pizza...best option for the price!

S-D6RO85sNxW-0nSborKFQ.text: Shopping in London proper for eats can be exhausting, that is if you do not know where to go especially in a saturated area of eats.  "Where to go for well seasoned non-touristy bits of eats?"Lucky for me, I called upon my good friend local to the area to pick out the place!I was pleasantly surprised to find pizza well seasoned with many choices including veggie choices! Comfortable atmosphere with plenty of seating! Nice flow of customers for eating in and take away which also is a good sign that others enjoy the eats here too! Prices are average. Come prepared to share your pie because the portions are on the larger side for european standards.Overall a great choice, and I will frequent again on my next stop in London.

C72Pa4dOlOG1m9puJW5LfA.text: Great value for money. fab when it is late, you are drunk, and you want some pizza. As a student I came here all the time and always had a quick, pleasant experience. (If you're looking for gourmet sit down this is not the place for you)

xPfqjvf0_uMG9UccmuFjOA.text: Great cheap pizza that is affordable delicious and huge portion sizes. The staff was friendly, and the feel of the place was old school pizza and no fuss. Def would come back.

GM7FNjWlqVYdKMN0Z2tuYg.text: Cheeeap yummy pizza in Fitzrovia = happy customers!I have never reviewed ICCo before because it is one of my go-to places when I've had some drinks and need to soak up the cocktails before I fall over. I remember it as being THE BEST PIZZA IN THE WORLD but...I don't trust my own drunken judgement as I have a tendency to be overly enthusiastic and love everyone/everything after about two drinks. Anyway...today I tried it sober at lunchtime and it was still lovely.- £5.50 pizza- It was huuuge so I still have leftovers for dinner- The line wasn't too long even on a Friday (although it was raining pretty hard today, maybe it's normally busier)I have to admit my drunken self was wrong, it's not the best pizza in the world...but it is pretty good for the price.

FU1Bgfh7adNXp-ZQBP_PVw.text: Hits the "greasy slice" spot.  As a New Yorker, I have particular (some would say "lofty") expectations for pizza, and most pizzas in London don't meet them.  ICCo is nowhere near my favorite New York joints - Gruppo, Totonno's, Motorino, Lombardi's - but it's a good take on a decent cheap pizza slice.  I should note that the pizza at ICCo isn't actually served as slices; you have to buy the whole pie, but they're cheap enough that it's not too big a deal.  If you want cheaper, you'll be down in the pre-made sandwich realm, and a hot, fresh pizza is definitely better than those.Lastly, the place feels like a NYC pizza joint.  Not exactly romantic, but cheerful enough and very serviceable for a quick bite.  I like it, I'll be back.

dlMAhL7SGvWzKYHaSHx1ag.text: ICCo is good just because it's so reasonably priced. Pizzas everywhere should be £5.50, that's how life should be. None of this £9 Pizza Express nonsense.They taste pretty good too, although as I watched fluorescent orange grease drip off a slice of my four cheeses I did have some questions about the ingredients. Who cares though, it's a perfect portion size for one. The fiorentina was nice too.It's got quite a New York feel to it which is fun (although they need to get some of those jars of parmesan and chili flakes). Coke only available in plastic bottles - bad (although good quantity wise, I was celebrating). I enjoyed that along with the highly unhealthy pizza menu, ICCo also provides a selection of cleansing smoothies.

eD8Z5zCo6Mt_ZWjFAhW1dQ.text: This place is a great choice for a large crowd with different pizza preferences. Central location and great prices mean that the place is always busy, but you never have to wait longer than 5-7 minutes for a pizza. I also like their cute blue light vibrating buzzers that let you know when the pizza is ready...  It is a very student style place  in terms of being affordable and chilled out.I honestly can't complain about the size or flavours of the pizzas as they worked fantastically well for me, however a few of my friends commented on the fact that pizzas did not have as much topping as they would have wanted... Take away options are slightly cheaper, and the stuff members are nice enough not to kick you out when you are eating take-away on the premises. They are also quite nice about us bringing our beers, but to be fair we did get told off in the end. However the experience of going to the toilet make your pink glasses slightly drop down. To get to the toilets you need to go through the kitchen/food storage/dish washing area and it slightly reveals the backstage process of how the pizza was made, and might give slight concerns of how well the ingredients are stored etc. It would have been so much better if I haven't seen these areas.

l4K7yjYDHo-j0qfWhSgGhg.text: Cheap and cheerful pizza place. Ideally for students and people on a small budget. Pizza is average, pretty large and good value for money.We ordered two pizzas - one with goats cheese and the other with an egg on top. Both myself and my friend weren't fond of the egg pizza, but the goats cheese was nice. All in all, worth a look, but don't make a special trip.

VcEr-VAC0ujkKmICy4o_dg.text: Yelp came up trumps once again. Searched for pizza and this gem was top of the list. Just what I like in a menu short and sweet with not too menu choices. Although the pricing caused just as many dilemmas because it was great. Do I go for a bigger pizza because I'm not that hungry but for that price.......Self service with friendly staff with sufficient seating on a clean and tidy environment.  Loads of customers  already seated and clearly enjoying themselves. Salami pizza was great and very tasty with a  perfect base.

tgpozxI80eDbp7JWoAjwhg.text: We ordered the tochia that was pepperoni chili and olives pizza. It's a decent size for 2ppl depending on how much you eat. Also cheap, but quality this pizza. We got 2 Cokes and pizza for under 10 pounds.

6TmYIPjyIa-LvFFjX8_72Q.text: ICCo is an incredibly unique place right in the middle of London. I don't think you could find a pizza this good for such a low price. The area is really open and you order at the counter and also pick up from the counter. Seating is on metal chairs and tables and I think a lot of people order and take-away. We tried the four cheese pizza and vegan pizza- also big props for doing a Vegan pizza! yeaaahahhhhahahha. Both were very good They have thin crusts and are mostly crispy. I think next time I'd really like to try a plain margherita just to judge how it is compared to others. This place gets 5 stars because they make really big, thin, and delicious pizzas for an incredible price. It's not exactly the best pizza I've ever had, but it's still pretty darn good.

photos.caption: Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom. Four cheese!
Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom. Vegan veggie!!!

spAE0YBAgQYsEQO8W_VGEw.text: Really good, inexpensive and creative pizza. As good as any I have ever had in NY, where I grew up. No alcohol unfortunately, but the food was delicious and service was quick!

FX68auk_HR7MJ3jbuo412g.text: I love this pizza! It's really good and cheap. On lunch time it's hard to find a table but it's worth to wait.

4t_6a_WKV-_xiL4_HCrxsQ.text: Love this place. The lady taking our order was so sweet, graciously putting up with our fumbling about trying to figure out our coins on a busy night, and making an awesome tasty green smoothie. The pizza was super yummy and inexpensive. Really loved this place, reminding me kind of Two Bros pizza stores(but better! :o) in NYC, except you get a whole pie for just a few quid! Taste wise it's also super yummy like NYC pizza!

WyIQnqXClqBdBcIGGSKfxg.text: Another excellent spot for pizza in London. Delicious and amazing value for money. The cafe has a buzzy atmosphere and is perfect for a quick/inexpensive bite.

5VXpX2qHX7S7J5BBzPDCWw.text: Always enjoy this casual place - excellent value, decent pizzas and reasonably priced bottle drinks plus juices etc. Order at the counter and they hand you a buzzer to alert you when it's ready. Usually busy, but I have never had trouble finding a seat. Service is usually pretty quick and efficient, don't expect special requests to be catered to at this price. Only downside was the last time I visited the music seemed to be the same song on loop, maybe to discourage overstayers - it worked as it was driving me nuts!

14QfHmnbi_dZygzrc45P1g.text: Great value! The prices are amazing, and the pizzas aren't too bad either. I don't think you can get a deal like this anywhere else.

nNTEvYIxdJzVpBwY9SLcrA.text: Individual Italian style pizza, £6 and made to order. What is there not to like?Order, grab your buzzer and go and sit down, if you're ordering in, try to make a space and grab your extras, chili flakes and oregano is freely available but the chili oil and garlic oil are in shorter supply. Grab it and keep ahold of it! I've had them stolen while I've gone to get my pizza before (I've had my entire place taken!).The pizza you get will be hot, thin, crispy and flavourful. I love the garlic oil here and covering the pizza with oregano and chili flakes, but getting takeout and not being able to do this is just as good.Don't normally grab a drink, this is a place to grab a quick bite before heading somewhere else. I just seem to end up here on a regular basis. Cheap, good and quick.

XgDGaI2zS6cX8-M6bVjZjw.text: I live in NY, and consider myself an expert in Pizza! To my surprise, some of the best pizza I've ever had is from this little gem! The fresh ingredients, and the tomato sauce tastes amazing! My favourite was the green smoothie tho, made me feel less guilty about eating a whole pizza!!

photos.caption: Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom. Fresh green smoothie

JmIc1oIyzO0AZs92mF9ROw.text: Sometimes you find somewhere in London and you just have to go 'Wow'.I can't believe how lucky I am to have found this place.Great pizza (although this isn't going to be the best you'll ever eat), quick service, and all starting at around £4 for a basic, and less than £10 when you add all the options.The pizza's are good sized too, if you order one, unless you have an extensive appetite, it's going to fulfill. Whilst it's nothing really to look at, I love functionality of the place, it's very American Diner in style, tall tables and stools in the middle, with shorter tables at the windows, although the colours are definitely Italian, Green, white and red.I also love the fact that they have so many oils and herbs for you to add, it's nice to have the choice and be able to customise.  The Greek salad is also okay, and is also cheap, at £2.5 I believe.I've not tried the deserts - the pizza is such a good portion that I didn't really need to, but at less than £3, they're also reasonable.It's not particularly a romantic date venue, but a great place to go for a quick bite, fast food at it's prime! I love coming here with friends before going for a drink, and sometimes pop in for a cheeky express lunch.

VyDxDsHWrwcqCP0OBkrE7w.text: A visit to this eatery is an experience if only to see how fast pizzas "fly" out of their ovens.  AND if you decide to eat one you won't be disappointed.All the pies are individual (12 inch) and very few toppings are NOT available.  Allowing you to customize to your taste.  All this at an average cost of 5-6 GBP they are possibly the best restaurant buy in London.It is self service, very crowded with long counter type tables.  Comfort level once seated in a very noisy environment is average for this type of eatery..  THAT SAID ICCO will be a regular stop on future trips to London.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

xuBrjyreSxL1zwi2kc_dPw.text: Do you want good, quick and cheap pizza?Well, stop looking because Icco is the place.Just make sure you have a table or place available, go over the counter and order your pizza.In a matter of minutes you will have a big, thin crusted, delicious pizza. I went nuts and added chilli and garlic oil and it was DELICIOUS. What about the price? Well, believe me when I tell you that 4-6 £ is all you need :)Vegan? No problem, there is a pizza with vegan cheese!!!!I will definitely come back, Icco, you just became my new favourite place.

k-O2fbufT24-f-FpwsNeBw.text: Big ol' pizza pies made to order and then dished out crispy and hot from the oven, what's not to like?!The prices hover around £6, which is half of what you would normally pay for a whole pie. Not exactly the kind of topics you'd find in the gourmet pizzerias that have popped up lately, but they have the solid basics.I ordered the capricciosa (£6), which had turkey ham, mushroom, black olives, and tomato sauce. I opted for no cheese, but the remaining ingredients were enough to carry the day.

b-nnMZpdFREpOCr5T_Brwg.text: ICCo is one of the very few Pizzerias in London that gives me the feeling of an actual Italian Rosticceria.The Pizza is great (and being Italian, I don't say that easily...), service is super fast and offers a great variety of choices for a very very affordable price. Oh, and yeah, is the one with the little buzz-thingy! is a lot of fun to see how people (myself included) get all excited when it's time to collect their fresh-out-of-the-oven pizza!

ABtpRDkBCF80Di10f59JyA.text: This pizza joint has been here since my uni days...err I went to uni more than 10 years ago :DAll the students from UCL loved it - cheap pizzas made fresh, ample spacing, thin crust, what's not to like? Order pizza, grab a drink, pay, eat and enjoy!The only lament is that it gets really really hot in here so you can't really eat in if you do not like stuffy places.

zLMQHS3H9fJ_-Dc5HbengA.text: Nothing amazing here. Thin small pies for a fair price. I saw some reviews saying how great this place was but I was not impressed at all. I ordered a Pepperoni Pie and it was a fair price at 5.95 pounds or nearly 10 American dollars so kind of expensive even. The pie, of course, was a personal size pie - i.e. small. I found the pie to lack flavor. There was a light sprinkling of cheese topped with some pepperoni. The girl cutting the pies into slices did a poor job and none of my slices were cut all the way through. It is not that hard of a job to cut a pizza pie. So as I ate my pie I had to rip it apart which was not a pleasant experience. I am not sure how any Yelper of gave more than three stars here. I can buy a large pie in Manhattan, NY for 8 dollars or about 4 pounds; now that's a deal! I am pretty sure I will not come back to this place. At least they gave me a receipt; probably because I had to pick up my food down the counter further.London people please expect more and do not accept mediocre. You are NOT getting good deals just because a restaurant says so.

photos.caption: Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom
Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom

Xl3-vXrdSO9Xh5hkei3O0Q.text: Ordered a vegan pizza last night, it came quickly, delicious, and I was satisfied. The only thing I have to complain about is, that the dough in the middle is not that well cooked. Maybe it is well cooked and I'm wrong, I mean, nothing a frying pan couldn't cure. It was still good. They should get into adding vegan style meats into the menu, so it's not a vegetable pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom

J9WBLONR2hrwgMxAfxrdlA.text: Great pizzas, thin crispy crusts, lots of (good) vegetarian options, great prices. Would definitely recommend!Great late night stop. While it doesn't have the classiest ambience, it's still pretty good and when full has a bit of a diner feel.

photos.caption: Photo of ICCo - London, United Kingdom. The Special is pretty special.

0eRTYa55UMwM3Qe9CFa4Sg.text: Bad experience , chicken pizza has bones , yelp score doesnt reflect the quality of restaurant . Think again before coming here

YdGBIW-ve0rxDO69qqT8UQ.text: Authentic, inexpensive and tasty. Great forStudents andLocal workers alike. ICCO has become a bit of a fitzrovian institution and the quality of the food speaks for itself.

BLJq5nbDX1S7wlfC2hbTJQ.text: Fantastic and extremely popular pizza place where you can takeaway a Hawaiian for a fiver. Don't be put off by the monsterous queue, it actually moves very quickly, and you'll be feeling really sick since you'll most likely eat the delicious contents of the box far too quickly.

J_otOiCR_BynMsSz-s3CIw.text: I love Icco, although I might be a bit biased and sentimental about it. The crust is the perfect thickness and for the price how could you complain. It's close to my uni and the pizza freshly made. Toppings can be a bit sparse, but for 4.50 I'm definitely not complaining.

skSZoohuhZUjAigLRdXzLA.text: I love Icco, although I might be a bit biased and sentimental about it. The crust is the perfect thickness and for the price how could you complain. It's close to my uni and the pizza freshly made. Toppings can be a bit sparse, but for 4.50 I'm definitely not complaining.

iVF24JR7UBQHa0Ou5huYpg.text: ICCO is a quick jaunt from Oxford Circus or anywhere around Euston Station.  The pizza is amazing, cheap, thin, and unique.  You might wait a little longer than you'd like, but it is worth it.  Not a bad place to eat, but not a bad thing to take out over to Gordon, Tavistock, or Russel Square.  They have a moderate drink selection.  I've never gone there for the coffee however.  It's the pizza that has me coming back.

oofxl2V2jkahKrATJnoU6A.text: The pizza is good, but we came here for the hot drinks and free croissant each morning during a recent stay in London. Really enjoyed sitting at the stainless steel tables, drinking several hot chocolates and watching the world go by for less than the cost of a hotel breakfast. Friendly place, but no frills.

JKYXtNevVvomBvQA9gUIkg.text: Morning coffee + free croissant= nuff said. Totally turned my morning around :). I have tried the pizza, very nice indeed. Ordered it for a whole office, it was made on time and no problems with transaction. The staff are lovely, even when the place is extremly busy.

bfAvViFLZv1-7xVR_Vtijg.text: Ecco seems to be the best value pizza restaurant in London. Pizzas are really well priced - about £4.50. They are also really tasty, with fresh ingredients on top. The restaurant is self service, and the service is quick. I think they may serve jacket potatoes at lunch time, but I have never tried these, because the pizza is too good. The atmosphere in the restaurant is busy and hectic, this isn't the place to come if you want a peaceful lunch. But if you want good, fresh, well priced food then it is a must.

IG7WBk6ztp_q1SU-rckzkQ.text: The food here is excellent without being too pricey. They deliver as well which is always a bonus.

cKlba_ieBMSaP2lE3y-UIA.text: this pizza place is fabulous. the pizzas are nice and made fresh to order. i just love this place!!!!!

LilPjoEBwgI7lIuwpoR2rQ.text: Oh Icco, how you make my heart flutter! Ok your exterior red, green and white facade may be a little tacky and yes there is always a queue of people trying to get their pizza before me but oh you make it worth it when my number is called and my delicious is pizza presented to me! Icco's is incredible value and prices start at £3.50 for their pizza's. My boyfriend and I have been known to share one of these on the days we've felt especially skint and it's fed us both very easily. Icco's is an especially popular option because so many of the restaurants near by are mediocre and overpriced. This place with all of it's hustle and bussle has twice as much atmosphere as them all put together and prices that would make their owners weep. A must try if you're ever in the area!

vanYpG1oT65bBo2FpgyJEA.text: I won't lie to you - this is not the best Pizza you will ever have in London, or indeed in your life (hopefully). What this is, is a place that serves up Pizza to order, quickly and cheaply. I've never spent more than £5. There's a great sense of satisfaction meandering back down Charlotte St with my ICCO pizza in hand smirking at the people in Pizza Express who've just paid a lot more for a pizza of similar quality. Maybe that's a bit mean.... The service is without frills, and you can eat in on large stainless steel communal tables if you like. A buzzer system alerts you to when your pizza is ready. Lovely, cheap and tasty carbs. I love it!

4zQeMvIBBKJeTZr5NwrOLw.text: For the price, you can't beat it. Good, fast, cheap pizza. Is there really anything else to add? Highly recommended

FZfptqfdM1aAk7_smzPFYw.text: Iccos is amazing! The pizzas are cooked fresh when you order, and you don't even have to wait for your name to be called anymore- they have new table buzzers.My favourite is margharita, nice and simple and only £3.50! They also have some nice salads and cakes, though a pizza can be filling enough.This place isn't posh, but it is a great place to get a quick and tasty bite to eat in central London.

uAsc66w-NiJaSprDWXC7SQ.text: Great pizza parlour that apparently does good coffee, too! This place has a large serving/seating area and throws out crispy, well-cooked pizzas at a quite alarming rate. They're great value and really tasty  excellent for a take-away or a spot for a quick catch-up lunch with friends.

qhq303kctlbbF3h7Mxa1sg.text: Fantastic place to go and eat in or take away if you fancy a delicouse thin crust pizza a 10" for only £3.50

CAJ8tgw19-mVnTXx8XEGlg.text: A friend of mine took me here over the weekend as I was craving a good pizza but had hardly any cash. Being in the middle of Central London, my hopes for having a pizza that wasn't sodden in plastic, greasy cheese weren't that high but I decided to go with it. I'm so glad I did - this £3.50 10'' pizza was one of the best pizzas I've ever tasted in the London! Definitely try it with the garlic & herb dip as an absolute must. Cooked fresh, served piping hot and with a smile - this is definitely one of my new favourites.

ytlkSTTfZzcUPGudN3KZlg.text: Cheap and yummy pizza. This place delivers your pizza fast and their price, despite being in the West End, is beyond reasonable. I like to mix it up and get some of the pizzas with loads of toppings and they are never wet in the middle and so just are soggy. One pizza is more than I can handle so when buying lunch for the guys, I get about 5 pizzas for 6 - 7 people. Excellent value for money!

w8BxEEI6CYobOjO6JF_ZFQ.text: 3 stars for the home of the 3£ pizza. My initial delight at finding such cheap pizza on my doorstep (at the time) was tempered somewhat by the fact.its not actually that great pizza. Well what do you expect for 3£? So this place is alright if you are looking for a cheap feed, but there are better choices nearby if your objective is to enjoy an excellent pizza.

bmrEkSDNgaBUUrghpMMO5g.text: OK, I will be judging this place on the merits of their anchovy pizza. Listed on the board as the Neptune, this pizza is alright. I won't be raving about it, but good grub for a fiver. Sometimes that's just what you need. The anchovies were not on every slice, big mistake. Uncool Italian Coffee Company that makes pizza. Ok, so there might've been alarm bells on that one. But legitimately, ICco is the only place I've found here that comes close to serving pizza at a reasonable price. Kinda reminds me of places in NY where you can get a slice, but you get a full plate of pizza. Pizza Express, come on. I'm just not going down that pretentious road. But here, for five pounds you get a decent sized meal. No frills, just that. College/university students swoon, I warn that all others might not. Enjoyable nonetheless.

HgCOd4OlMlbjMBsYY4Zz5g.text: Sure, it's cheap and you get a lot of pizza for your pound.  But it's a madhouse in here for lunch, the pizza is greasy and heavy, and the toppings limited and rather standard issue.  Were I a student I'd be signing up for their club card, but as someone who prefers to not spend the afternoon with a cheesy brick tying up my innards, I'll pass.

fDOiPCV2nYZm3e2acK10RQ.text: Iccos make delicious Pizzas that are amazing value, a margarita costs £3, if you add more toppings you pay extra but you never pay more than £4.I love going here with my friends as it's a great place to come and get some quality cheap pizza. The stainless steel interior reminds me of the New York Pizzerias!The only downside is it's always busy and it can be hard to get a table sometimes but they allso do takeaway! and you can sit outside in the summer!

i3I1YBf3eP0BDR6QU80vOQ.text: I really wanted to like this place as there are not very good pizza places around.  But the sauce is what makes really great pizza and this place taste like it comes out of the can.  Good open atmosphere though and the food is cheap.  However I'll stick with Dominos for now.

JFk3wVtWliD-vtLBl7vu_Q.text: I first went to ICCo when I was down in London with a friend when I was 16, and since moving down I have become a regular. It is in Fitzrovia and as one might expect the clientele is mixed, but with quite a few students and ad execs. The pizzas are displayed on a board at the front, and whilst there are also salads these aren't really worth bothering with. The pizzas are in in the thin based Italian style and really tasty as well as being really cheap. The coffee is also pretty good. There is seating inside and out. It can get a little noisy inside so if its not too cold or rainy outside is better.A great place, the sort London could do more with.

in3NEGD6OqJ02QUdBx5ZDw.text: Firstly, it's the atmosphere of the place, as mentioned elsewhere there is always a birthday or other celebration going on here, and the staff are fantastic, friendly and helpful. They have a lovely range of pasta & pizza dishes, and the prices are excellent value. I take my daughter here at least once a week, and she loves the Carbonara and the pizza garlic bread. You do get very large portions, so if you're going for a lunchtime, it's worth asking for a smaller portion, otherwise afternoon work tends to be a little less productive!

MlUILhNFXTasKLuq4Ln4FA.text: Freshly baked pizza for less than 5 quid and served to you in less than 10-12 minutes (usually!!!) Perfect place for a cheap student like me who likes her food fresh, hot and delicious! No reheating shit happens here, and the best part is the pizza is thin crust and not doughy, so you can very easily have the whole thing! How I loved my time in London thanks to ICCO! They also dish out decent coffee..A great meal for under 7 quid :)They prefer Cash so go armed if you intend only to have their 3.5 quid margherita!

H0nZYavwdph8tIFUxcXMGw.text: I lunch here with my colleagues every few weeks. Actually, thinking about it, I've been coming to Ecco since my undergrad days and that was quite some time ago.It's the same as ever, although now they hand out a vibrating contraption to alert you when your pizza is ready. A welcome step from previously having to strain your ears, listening out for your name to be called, which usually sounded nothing like it's supposed to be.Pizza's are £3-£5. 11", thin base, decent variety of toppings, freshly made, not circular.It can get ridiculously busy during lunch time, especially in the summer and it's not the kind of place you'd want to keep sitting in. We eat and go and it's perfect for that.Nommy.

bXuxFHkSht4jJJ0gsuCRcA.text: Oh man, I really love this place. As I said in my Londonist What's for Lunch? review, it's hard to beat "good, cheap, hot, fresh pizza." Whether for a quick lunch or a late night treat, Icco's a gem. Here's that lunch review:londonist.com/2008/11/wh…

dutALo-2I_qpZZojYvedzw.text: If you fancy pizza in the West End then this is one of the best value and quality places for a proper Italian pizza and espresso.

6uh0kHm8CvSgI_nzf9tTSQ.text: Okay!  So, if you want a crapton of really quite good pizza for a great price, this is your place to go.  Don't be deterred by the name of this place..it's more about pizza than coffee from my experience.  I was there in the evening, and it was impossible to find a place to sit, initially, and it was so loud and busy, it wasn't condusive to intimate conversation.  BUT, the food was plentiful and really really good.  Also, despite the queues, the food was done very quickly.  I was quite impressed.  The waitstaff were rude as hell to us, but who cares?  We got hot fresh pizza quickly for cheapo.  And had a great pint at the pub across the street.  Yay!
